name: ghostliness
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the quality of being pale and transparent in a way that does not seem real, like a ghost: the shimmering ghostliness of the northern lights The artist's colours are pale to the point of ghostliness. See
ghostly
More examplesFewer examplesThere is a ghostliness about empty boats that disturbs her.Through the length of the play, Isobel appears in her ghostliness on the fringes of every scene.A faint ghostliness filled the windows of the building and then the mist blotted it out.
